poem:
"Tick Tock in the Family Clock"

Upon the table of intention,
An antique specter tolls division.
The clock, a broken heirloom, counts no time,
Yet marks the moments of love-turned-resign.
Inherited grief gilded in gold,
A legacy of silence, tales untold.
To children glance at hands, frozen in dismay:
A father's departure, a family's grey day.
